form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Heinrich introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the Act of July 31, 1947, to provide for the termination of certain mineral materials contracts.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Mineral Materials Contracts Termination Act.
Section 2 of the Act of July 31, 1947 (commonly known as the Materials Act of 1947) (30 U.S.C. 602) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: If the holder of a valid mineral materials contract entered into under this Act (referred to in this subsection as the contract) submits to the Secretary a request to terminate the contract before production is initiated under the contract and before any surface disturbance has occurred under the contract, the Secretary may—

subparagraph.text: return to the contract holder any bid deposit and performance bond paid by the contract holder to the Bureau of Land Management under the contract.

paragraph.text: Acceptance of an amount returned under paragraph (1)(B) by the contract holder shall constitute—

subparagraph.text: a full and final settlement of the contract; and
an agreement on the part of the contract holder not to bring a civil action against the United States with respect to the contract.
